alert.note: Alert for Caddo; De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 1:04PM CST until January 28 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake affecting Caddo and De Soto Parishes. For the Lakes...including Wallace Lake...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cypress Bayou at Wallace Lake. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 149.0 feet, The subdivision in southwest Shreveport off Kingston Road and Stagecoach Road could become cut-off due to rising water. Portions of Keithville-Kingston Road, Linwood Road, Barron Road, and secondary roadways around southern Kingston Road area could also see impacts from rising waters, along with parts of Southern Trace Golf Course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 149.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 142.0 feet. - Forecast...The lake will continue rise another tenth or two more following overnight rainfall across the basin. Otherwise, a slow fall will commence by early next week. - Action stage is 149.0 feet. - Flood stage is 151.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 115 PM CST.
